Title: US DOE to end LNG permit pause by end of Q1 2025
Description: The US Department of Energy (DOE) expects to finish its review of the potential impact of approving more LNG export capacity and end its temporary halt on issuing licenses to new infrastructure projects by the end of the first quarter of 2025, one of the agency’s top officials said.
Author: JS

Title: Flexible LNG contracts beneficial for EU’s surplus re-export: ACER
Description: LNG is expected to provide most of the required flexibility to accommodate EU gas supply and demand balance, according to the EU’s Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER), with exposure to free-on-board (FOB) contracts allowing the bloc to sell surplus cargoes on the spot market.
Author: JS
